arabic.title: يوم ما الشعب اتغير
text: و السما فوقنا رصاصى والامل ميت غريق
كنا فاقدين الهوية والحياة زي الممات
كنا و كان و ده زمان
كنا و كان و ده زمان
و في صبح اخضر ملوش مثيل
يوم التقينا فى ميدانها الأسمر الاصيل
و في صبح اخضر ملوش مثيل
يوم التقينا فى ميدانها الأسمر الاصيل
يوم ما اتفاجئنا إننا بنحب بعض
يوم ما اتفاجئنا إننا بنحب بعض
ثورة تحرر ثورة تقرر ثورة تعيد ترتيب القصر

english.title: The Day When The People Changed
text: We used to realize that the road doesn't lead to a way.
And the sky above us grey, and the hope drowned deceased.
We had lost our identity, and life was similar to death.
We were all muted inside the silence.
We were....this was....and this was the past.
We were....this was....and this was the past.
On a green morning unsimilar to any other
Was the day we met in its tanned rooted square.
On a green morning unsimilar to any other
Was the day we met in its tanned rooted square.
The day we were struck that not only do we love each other,
But we would die for each other too.
The day we were struck that not only do we love each other,
But we would die for each other too.
That day the Crescent embraced the Cross,
It was the day the flame of our uproar was ignited.
On that day the people changed,
Started to talk and became sovereign
That day we emerged to say it's unacceptable,
We are the Egyptian people and this is our rising voice.
That day a revolution started in Egypt.
A revolution to free, a revolution to judge, a revolution that will rearrange the palace.
That day the world prayed and saw us
Capturing those who stole, those who slaughtered,
Those who deceived us from the start.
With the green blood of its martyrs
With the resolve of her youth, standing, enduring
With the green blood of its martyrs
With the resolve of her youth, standing, enduring
That day the world stood up and applauded
The virtuous and the souls of the martyrs
